title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.3 BIRTH REGISTRATION

description.narrative: Output 3.3. A comprehensive Birth and Death Registration system that will provide the necessary framework for the universal, continuous and free of charge birth registration of all children in Uganda., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection â€“ General, Data And Child Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. A comprehensive and functional national and subnational system that prevents gender-based violence and violence against children and delivers quality and equitable response services to survivors and victims.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3. A comprehensive Birth and Death Registration system that will provide the necessary framework for the universal,continuous and free of charge birth registration of all children in Uganda.

description.narrative: Birth registration services were progressively scaled up using the upgraded Mobile VRS to 117 NIRA district offices, while issuance of birth certificates was decentralized from the national and regional levels to 80 districts across the country, including in the eight learning districts. This resulted from UNICEF’s advocacy, technical and financial support to the National Identification and Registration Authority (NIRA), to hire a consultant to upgrade the Mobile VRS, to enable it perform the entire birth registration process (birth notification, registration and certification). | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2021
